title: griddy
author: griddy
content: Hi, i am a bit blocked by being active on Bitcointalk, i cannot send more than 1 PM / hour, more than 1 reply / 360 seconds, 2PMs per day.It's telling me, that i need to buy copper membership to increase my limit. But it would be welcome (and profitable for Bitcointalk) is there will be some href on the copper word in this message.Can please, anyone navigate me where i can see the membership benefits?any help is welcome.

comments.author: mk4
comments.body: What tranthidung said.First off, why do you need so much PMs per day though? Unless you're messaging multiple people for whatever reason, it's probably best to move the conversation to the likes of Telegram or Signal.

Unless you're messaging multiple people for whatever reason, it's probably best to move the conversation to the likes of Telegram or Signal.Completely agree with you, I am writing them my Discord address, but i got another questions in the PM Then i cannot answer for a day and they are thnking i am inactive or so.Unfortunately, i cannot have telegram/signal/whatsapp/viber as my company strict rules - no apps on your phone, no private phone at work. So i am using web version of Discord.PS: i am not messaging (usually) people, they are messaging me. But it's not a big number of PMs, it's like 4-6 daily

But it's not a big number of PMs, it's like 4-6 daily@LoyceV already responded to your request and I agree with him/her... Instead of using your hourly/daily limits for sending your Discord address, why don't you just include it in your "other thread" and force them to contact you through there?- You can also use the URL part of your profile [like tranthidung, mk4 and me] to showcase your Discord address: Profile tab > Forum Profile Information (under "Modify Profile") > Fill in the "Website title and URL" fields > Click the "Change profile" button.
